Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2010 12:30AM duman wrote: I am recently diagnosed with mets to my spine, ribs  and pelvis, as well as most of my organs, I asked not to know the severity of the bone scan but my oncologist told me she suspected I would glow like a Christmas tree.
Posts.Title: where are your bone mets located?? skigrl lady4law

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2010 12:38AM duman wrote: I have two kids, a son who is 6 and a daugher who is 14, telling them I had termial cancer is the hardest thing Ive ever done in my life.  My son is coping fairly well and he thinks Im going on a trip, my daugher is so angry,I dont know how to talk to her, she avoids me as much as she can and part of me understands it..  I am trying to arrange some counselling for her.  I am in a wheelchair and dont contribute a whole lot to the daily running of the household.
Posts.Title: Any Mums with Teens/Young Kids? frangipangi juliaw

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2010 11:35PM duman wrote: my hubby has been great, he has stayed in the hospital with me when ive been in and thru all the treatments.  I have a great family and friends who help out with the kids to allow this to happen.  I am taking this one day at a time but lately the fear does become overwhelming and i just go with it, iv cried more in the last few weeks than my entire life.  I am a spiritual person, i dont go to church but i believe in God.  Not to sound like a nut but I have left it with God to deal with and it does help.  I try not to let it run my life daily but it is getting harder, im now in a wheelchair and need alot of help physically, bathing, ext.  Hope this helps, stay positive.
Posts.Title: Any Mums with Teens/Young Kids? frangipangi juliaw

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2010 11:29PM duman wrote: i had terrible rib pain skigrl all fall and assumed it was from a fall, like scotty01 i had alot of physio and they thought was compression factures,  Ironic but the pain went away with the diagnosis.  I knew there was something drastically wrong but it took along time for the docs to take me seriously, just had my 3rd chemo treatment today and have had 2 rounds of rad.  So far so good.  Good luck to you all.
Posts.Title: where are your bone mets located?? skigrl lady4law
